snippet: Google blocked an anti-Muslim video on YouTube, which it owns, in Egypt and in Libya, but did not take it down altogether.
abstract: Google, owner of YouTube, blocks access in Egypt and Libya to video that has incited violence across the Arab world; action is unusual, since the video does not violate the company's terms of service, and brings up questions about freedom of expression and censorship.
lead_paragraph: Google blocked an anti-Muslim video on YouTube, which it owns, in Egypt and in Libya, but did not take it down altogether.

headline.seo: Google Blocks Inflammatory Video in Egypt and Libya
headline.main: As Violence Spreads in Arab World, Google Blocks Access to Inflammatory Video
headline.print_headline: As Violence Spreads in Arab World, Google Blocks Access to Inflammatory Video
